dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 34/50, the charity demonstrates a high donor fit for those seeking to support religious and cultural causes through sadaqah [3]. The mission addresses urgent needs such as food insecurity and emergency medical relief, which are high-priority areas for many donors in the community [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization's impact score of 8/50 reflects concerns regarding financial transparency and program spending, as only 5.0% of the $6,039,144 total revenue is directed toward program expenses [1][2]. While the charity provides direct provision of goods, there is a lack of third-party evidence regarding the long-term effectiveness of its life skills and medical programs [1].

baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Colorado, the Islamic Oasis Center CO operates a monthly food pantry and provides life skills training for refugees and low-income individuals [2]. The organization also manages international relief efforts, including a Gaza Emergency Response and medical support programs [2][3].

strengths.detail: The organization reports spending <cite id="1">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, indicating that no donor funds are currently diverted to professional fundraising fees.
The charity maintains <cite id="1">17.2 months of operating reserves</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term sustainability and emergency response capacity.
Operating since <cite id="1">2008</cite>, the organization has nearly two decades of experience serving <cite id="2">refugee and low-income communities</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Oasis Center CO exhibits high financial stability, characterized by its <cite id="2">$5,726,976 in total assets</cite> and a lack of debt-heavy operations. Its <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite> provides a layer of oversight, while its <cite id="4">17.9% revenue growth rate</cite> suggests increasing community trust and donor support. The organization's ability to maintain <cite id="1">high working capital</cite> ensures it can sustain its <cite id="2">monthly food pantry</cite> and international commitments even during periods of economic volatility.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">2008</cite>, the Islamic Oasis Center CO is a Colorado-based organization dedicated to supporting <cite id="2">low-income families and refugee populations</cite> through both local and international humanitarian initiatives. The organization's primary domestic mission involves operating a <cite id="2">monthly food pantry and providing life skills training</cite> to facilitate community integration. Beyond its local footprint, the charity has expanded its scope to include international relief, specifically advertising a <cite id="3">Gaza Emergency Response, medical support, and orphan care</cite> across regions including Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Somalia. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="2">$6,039,144 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 17.9%</cite>. While the charity demonstrates significant growth and maintains <cite id="1">17.2 months of working capital</cite>, its reported <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 5.0%</cite> is critically low compared to the <cite id="4">peer median of 81.7%</cite>. This discrepancy suggests that the organization's financial reporting may be incomplete or that a substantial portion of its <cite id="2">$5,726,976 in net assets</cite> has not yet been deployed into direct service delivery.
